chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Brunker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called:
INCLUDES 13CF11, 14CM902, 14CM908, 15CF1016.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Genelle Johnson.

PLEA HEARING IN 15CF1016:
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Resist Officer-Substantial Bolidy Harm/Soft Tissue Injury-Repeater)>>DRI.
  
PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 2 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>> 2 Years WSPS, 1 Year IC and 1 Year ES, Concurrent to any other sentence. Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. COURT finds 178 days credit. Defendant is eligible for programming. 

SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION ON 13CF11, 14CM908, 14CM908:
COURT ORDERS:
13CF11:
Ct. 1 (Burglary-Building or Dwelling-Repeater)>> 8 Years WSPS, 4 Year IC and 4 Year ES, Concurrent to any other sentence. COURT finds 493 days credit. Defendant is eligible for programming. Outstanding financial obligations to be converted to a Civil Judgment.

Ct. 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take-Repeater)>> 2 Years WSPS, 1 Year IC and 1 Year ES, Concurrent to any other sentence. COURT finds 181 days credit. Defendant is eligible for programming. Outstanding financial obligations to be converted to a Civil Judgment.

14CM908:
